channel.title: CVE Feed for Becton, Dickinson and Company (BD) -- FACSChorus
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Becton, Dickinson and Company (BD) -- FACSChorus

item.title: CVE-2023-29066|2024-08-02T14:00:15.314Z -- becton%2C%20dickinson%20and%20company%20%28bd%29 -- facschorus
item.description: The FACSChorus software does not properly assign data access privileges for operating system user accounts. A non-administrative OS account can modify information stored in the local application data folders.

item.title: CVE-2023-29061|2024-08-02T14:00:14.960Z -- becton%2C%20dickinson%20and%20company%20%28bd%29 -- facschorus
item.description: There is no BIOS password on the FACSChorus workstation. A threat actor with physical access to the workstation can potentially exploit this vulnerability to access the BIOS configuration and modify the drive boot order and BIOS pre-boot authentication.

item.title: CVE-2023-29060|2024-08-02T14:00:14.601Z -- becton%2C%20dickinson%20and%20company%20%28bd%29 -- facschorus
item.description: The FACSChorus workstation operating system does not restrict what devices can interact with its USB ports. If exploited, a threat actor with physical access to the workstation could gain access to system information and potentially exfiltrate data.

item.title: CVE-2023-29062|2024-08-02T14:00:15.040Z -- becton%2C%20dickinson%20and%20company%20%28bd%29 -- facschorus
item.description: The Operating System hosting the FACSChorus application is configured to allow transmission of hashed user credentials upon user action without adequately validating the identity of the requested resource. This is possible through the use of LLMNR, MBT-NS, or MDNS and will result in NTLMv2 hashes being sent to a malicious entity position on the local network. These hashes can subsequently be attacked through brute force and cracked if a weak password is used. This attack would only apply to domain joined systems.

item.title: CVE-2023-29064|2024-08-02T14:00:15.704Z -- becton%2C%20dickinson%20and%20company%20%28bd%29 -- facschorus
item.description: The FACSChorus software contains sensitive information stored in plaintext. A threat actor could gain hardcoded secrets used by the application, which include tokens and passwords for administrative accounts.

item.title: CVE-2023-29065|2024-08-02T14:00:14.915Z -- becton%2C%20dickinson%20and%20company%20%28bd%29 -- facschorus
item.description: The FACSChorus software database can be accessed directly with the privileges of the currently logged-in user. A threat actor with physical access could potentially gain credentials, which could be used to alter or destroy data stored in the database.

item.title: CVE-2023-29063|2024-08-02T14:00:14.934Z -- becton%2C%20dickinson%20and%20company%20%28bd%29 -- facschorus
item.description: The FACSChorus workstation does not prevent physical access to its PCI express (PCIe) slots, which could allow a threat actor to insert a PCI card designed for memory capture. A threat actor can then isolate sensitive information such as a BitLocker encryption key from a dump of the workstation RAM during startup.
